title: Continuation of the National Emergency With Respect to Significant Malicious Cyber-Enabled Activities
summary: The document titled "Continuation of the National Emergency With Respect to Significant Malicious Cyber-Enabled Activities," dated March 27, 2025, announces the extension of a national emergency first declared in 2015 under Executive Order 13694. This emergency addresses threats to U.S. national security, foreign policy, and economy from malicious cyber activities, particularly those originating from outside the country. The document outlines the history of related executive orders aimed at combating these threats, including recent actions taken in 2025. It concludes that due to the ongoing nature of these threats, the national emergency will continue for another year beyond April 1, 2025. This extension will be published in the Federal Register and communicated to Congress, emphasizing the government's commitment to addressing cyber threats.
